column4: Hi, Can anyone tell me a good virtualization software for Ubuntu 8.04, I am currently thinking of installing VirtualBox, Can someone tell me, should i go with Xen or VMware or VirtualBox is good enough.
what do you want to accomplish with the vm?
Just cross platform testing as well need to install softwares like Autocad and Photoshop CS3
those are very demanding apps, i can recommend using either qemu with kvm support of you have the right cpu, or vmware
xen _could_ work as well with kvm, it has been used to boot windows, but i guess qemu and vmware are easier :)
: Do you recommend not to install VirtualBox.
well i don't really like virtualbox that much, vmware has more features and performs well
vmware-workstation and vmware-virtualcenter can be renewed every 30 days by requesting a new trial key ^^
http://www.easyvmx.com/ this can get you a vm for vmware player
lsilogic scsi performs best, but for winxp you'll need a driver disk, it's all in the guest os install guide, google it you'll find lots of info ;)
: Thanks, will read all the info, hope it is easy. Does it work in AMD_64 as well
yes, and you can get a 64 bit vm, with smp too iirc
btw i meant to tell you about vmware forum, scheize
you could try that, or vmtn, which you can find here http://communities.vmware.com/home.jspa
